CatDescriptText: Mr. John Allen, 2222 Hallet Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think it justifiable for residents to "put the finger" (notify law enforcement officers) on rackets if they exist in their respective communities?" Answer reads: "Yes, because a racket is something the law just doesn't allow."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Allen, wearing plaid corduroy cap, and two jackets, standing in front of stone block wall
